alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jeff Davis and southwestern Culberson Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 630 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Plateau, or 15 miles west of Kent, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Plateau. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 147 and 170. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor
